arttitle: VeriFone Commander EMV Rapid Connect Software
artbody:
This article contains all available information concerning the VeriFone Commander EMV Rapid Connect Software.  Please check news postings on the front page of Reflex for any updates that become available to this article.   

Please be sure to read this article thoroughly to verify all steps are taken when assisting a site/tech on this upgrade. 

Guide:

VASC Playbook for Valero EMV

Additional Support Documents:

Auto Upgrade

Sales Bulletin

FD Network Conversion

Update 10/02/17:

Please click here for a list of TNSLink routers that were not active at the time TNS remotely deployed the routing changes to support Rapid Connect.  If a site on the list calls in to report issues connecting to Rapid Connect, please follow the instructions below (previously provided).

Send an email to: globalbroadband@tnsi.com 

Subject line:  Verifone EMV/Rapid Connect Conversion Connectivity Issue

 

Body Contents:

 

TNS Router ID: 

               IE:  VLRJOBBERDEALER

 

**Note: No Change to remainder – please include as-is**

 

The site referenced above has had the commander updated to redirect Transaction Authorizations to ONE of the following 2 FDC “Rapid Connect” Hosts:

 

204.194.127.203 (fdc50a-host-79) – Verifone configured

204.194.139.203 (fdc50a-host-80)

 

TNS router should include a NAT to each of the above FDC Hosts and ACL Permits from 172.16.20.x.

Commander IP’s will be as follows:

VLR Direct Clients:            172.16.20.12 (host-1)

VLR Branded Clients:       wrs, vps, gpmi: 172.16.20.135 (host-135)

fsm: 172.16.20.235 (host-235)

 

Update 9/15/17:

If you get a site that is switching from any Point of Sale to a Commander/Rapid connect,  you will need to request a new merchant id from Mitzi.   The id's CANNOT be flipped.  Please contact Mitzi as soon as possible to get the request in. 

Update 8/29/17:

The wholesale communications team will be emailing the attached documents to our distributors this week and posting them on the Wholesale portal.  Verifone has offered to assist sites during business hours with configuring the EMV settings.  The attached Sales Bulletin provides the steps sites will need to follow.  In addition to the Sales Bulleting, we will be emailing the Auto Upgrade document.

Steps at a high level:

  • Sites will need to request a software upgrade to 3.02.34 via http://support.verifone.com , see the detailed steps in the Sales Bulletin
    • Site has to have an active ASM contract
    • Site has to have connectivity to Verifone’s Remote Software Delivery (VRSD) server
      • The commander communicates to VRSD through the EZR
    • Site will process credit on terminal 001 on ATL105 until EMV conversion is completed by Verifone
    • If sites do not know their service ID, see article 463
  • Once software upgrade is complete, site will need to visit support.verifone.com to request EMV configuration assistance from Verifone, see the detailed steps in the Sales Bulletin
    • Verifone will work directly with the site on scheduling a date and time to complete the configuration (terminal 002)
    • There are two document links presented on http://support.verifone.com, one provides guidance on where to locate the information requested by Verifone (FD Network Conversion, attached), the other document is a generic sales bulletin (not attached)

I have also attached a document that has images of support.verifone.com, please let me know if additional information is needed.

Update 08/15/17:

We have asked Verifone to release the Commander EMV software (3.02.34) to production.  The announcement to our branded distributors will go out 08/15/17.  Linked above is an update reference guide that will be provided to Verifone installers.  This guide replaces all previous documents.  This software will only support inside EMV.

It is very likely that the VASCs will call the help desk for support.  Please make sure to reference the attached document to answer questions.  
Here are some important items concerning the upgrade:

  • All sites will use terminal 002 for Rapid Connect
  • The VASC will only need to configure a host specific route for Rapid Connect

All service providers have made the necessary changes to support the new routes to Rapid Connect. 

***Additional Steps Required***:

Issues have been identified with the First Data merchant profile setup on terminal 002.  Please make the following corrections, then set site for a PDL and validate it pulls successfully.  First Data has been notified.

Step 1: Update Day Close Password

  1. Log in to Clientline and go to Profile Maintenance > Merchant Setup > Settlement/Other Info. tab. 

  2. You will see the field labeled "Password" in the right hand column.  Replace the 123456 with 111111 in this field and press "Update" at the bottom right hand side of the page. 

Step 2: Update Card Settings

  1. Navigate to Terminal Setup > Search Terminal.  Enter in the store's MID and use 2 for the Terminal No.

  2. Click on the Cards Accepted tab

  3. Enable Velocity for Proprietary Card 1

  4. Enable Buypass Fleet (leave the Velocity box unchecked)

  5. Enable Diners and check option for velocity.

Step 3: Update Velocity Settings

  1. Navigate to Velocity > Update Velocity

  2. Update Velocity parameters on terminal 002 – should be 2/200 for line 1.  Enter following amounts and the hit "Add":

    1. Daily Count - 2
    2. Daily Amount - 200.0
    3. Period Count - 2
    4. Period Amount - 200.0
